content.description:
Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at point (negative 2 comma 0). The curve trends down steeply, then levels to a minimum at the point (negative 1 comma negative 3).

At point (negative 1 comma negative 3), the curve trends up gradually, then steeply, passes through the origin, then levels to a maximum at the point (1 comma 3).

At point (1 comma 3), the curve trends down gradually, then steeply, passes through the point (2 comma 0), then levels to a minimum at the point (3 comma negative 3).

At point (3 comma negative 3), the curve trends up gradually, then steeply, passes through the point (4 comma 0), then levels to a maximum at the point (5 comma 3).

At point (5 comma 3), the curve trends down gradually, then steeply, and ends at point (6 comma 0).

​Let <math alttext="f"> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> be a sinusoidal function. The graph of <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane.
content.question: What is the period of <math alttext="f"> <semantics> <mi>f</mi> <annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

topic.text: 3.7: Sinusoidal Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Identify information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and verbal representations to answer a question or construct a model, with and without technology.
